item.title: Bloom for Search From Scratch
item.description: The Bloom filter is a data structure that tracks set-membership in a fast and space-efficient way. I first heard about Bloom filters when a start-up I was working for used Bloom filters to speed up their database search. Then, I heard about Microsoft using a stack of bloom filters (a bit-sliced document signature data structure) to speed up the Bing search engine’s keyword search. In this project, I explored these interesting data structures by implementing a Bloom filter and a bit-sliced document signature in C. I also wrote unit tests and a collection of fun demos to show how Bloom filters and bit-sliced signatures can be used. This report gives an overview of the project, demos and results, and highlights notable code design decisions.
